title: Arrays
description: Arrays in BPL are fixed-size, contiguous collections of elements with the same type. Array indices are zero-based (first element at index 0). The array size must be a compile-time constant. Arrays can be initialized with brace syntax or element-by-element assignment. When passed to functions, arrays decay to pointers, losing size information - you must pass the size separately. Array bounds are not checked at runtime, so accessing out-of-bounds indices causes undefined behavior. This example shows array declaration, initialization, iteration, and common patterns.
